body: Likely fallout from the tiff ifd changes.  Sounds like something is pulling from the legacy system that should be pulling from the _v2 system.
Git bisect is giving me the TiffIFD rearrangement for where this broke.

Can you check out the fix here? https://github.com/wiredfool/Pillow/commit/157df44e51ef1436fe3a878b835ec8b4c57d19b0

Also, is it ok to distribute the sample tiff file under the MIT license?

If you can't build pillow, it's ok to find the existing TifftTags.py file from ypur pillow installation and replace it with the one in that commit. It's a small change that doesn't affect any of the binaries.

Looks like the fix worked. Thanks! 

I don't know the license status of that tiff file. It's part of our test suite, so presumably it's under the same license as the rest of PyInstaller, which is GPL with an exception for the startup code in built applications.

issue.title: icc_profile is a tuple when a buffer was expected on TIFF
issue.body:
### What I did

```
from six import BytesIO
from PIL import Image

# https://ntnu.tind.io/record/109/files/UBT-TO-000008.tif
img = Image.open("UBT-TO-00008.tif")
buffer = BytesIO()
img.save(buffer, "png", quality=90)
```
### What happened

I'm using: Pillow (3.0.0)

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/invenio/.virtualenvs/maint-2.0/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/Image.py", line 1665, in save
    save_handler(self, fp, filename)
  File "/home/invenio/.virtualenvs/maint-2.0/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/PngImagePlugin.py", line 757, in _save
    data = name + b"\0\0" + zlib.compress(im.info["icc_profile"])
TypeError: must be string or read-only buffer, not tuple
```
### What was expected

If I'm using: Pillow (2.9.0), it works.

issue.title: Updated deprecated asserts
issue.body: When running these tests, I get `DeprecationWarning: Please use assertTrue instead.`

body:
perhaps i'm missing something, but doesn't the changes in https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/1539 reopen this issue? I think this has been missed since the `test_iccprofile` test case doesn't attempt to save the image as a `PNG`, which is what triggered this issue initially.

e.g. if i change the test case to try and save the tif as a png

```
Pillow tristan$ git diff
diff --git a/Tests/test_file_tiff_metadata.py b/Tests/test_file_tiff_metadata.py
index 1b88fca..cc42163 100644
--- a/Tests/test_file_tiff_metadata.py
+++ b/Tests/test_file_tiff_metadata.py
@@ -172,7 +172,7 @@ class TestFileTiffMetadata(PillowTestCase):
         im = Image.open('Tests/images/hopper.iccprofile.tif')
         out = self.tempfile('temp.tiff')

-        im.save(out)
+        im.save(out, "PNG")
         reloaded = Image.open(out)
         self.assert_(type(im.info['icc_profile']) is not type(tuple))
         self.assertEqual(im.info['icc_profile'], reloaded.info['icc_profile'])
```

the test case now fails with the original error reported in this issue:

```
Pillow tristan$ python Tests/test_file_tiff_metadata.py
..E=== orphaned temp file: /var/folders/f_/mzl0w36s1kvct7sg_zm4n__m0000gn/T/temprzr2wA.tiff
...=== orphaned temp file: /var/folders/f_/mzl0w36s1kvct7sg_zm4n__m0000gn/T/tempggjXpC.tif
.=== orphaned temp file: /var/folders/f_/mzl0w36s1kvct7sg_zm4n__m0000gn/T/tempc2grCt.tiff
.
======================================================================
ERROR: TestFileTiffMetadata.test_iccprofile
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "Tests/test_file_tiff_metadata.py", line 175, in test_iccprofile
    im.save(out, "PNG")
  File "build/bdist.macosx-10.10-x86_64/egg/PIL/Image.py", line 1675, in save
    save_handler(self, fp, filename)
  File "build/bdist.macosx-10.10-x86_64/egg/PIL/PngImagePlugin.py", line 757, in _save
    data = name + b"\0\0" + zlib.compress(im.info["icc_profile"])
TypeError: must be string or read-only buffer, not tuple

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 8 tests in 0.033s

FAILED (errors=1)
```

rolling back the changes in https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/1539 fixes this, but of course fails for the test case added in https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/1539

this is running on OSX, with python 2.7.10 on the current master

```
Pillow tristan$ python -c "import PIL; print PIL.PILLOW_VERSION"
3.2.0.dev0
```

I agree with @tristan this issue still exists. Steps to reproduce:

```
$ cat <<EOF > test.py
from __future__ import print_function

import sys
from PIL import Image, PILLOW_VERSION

img = Image.open(sys.argv[1])
print(PILLOW_VERSION)
print(type(img.info['icc_profile']))
EOF

$ pip install -q --user pillow==2.9.0 && python test.py ~/Desktop/Trichoglossus_moluccanus_with_open_wings\,_Brisbane-CMYK.tif
2.9.0
<type 'str'>

$ pip install -q --user pillow==3.0.0 && python test.py ~/Desktop/Trichoglossus_moluccanus_with_open_wings\,_Brisbane-CMYK.tif 
3.0.0
<type 'tuple'>

$ pip install -q --user pillow==3.1.0 && python test.py ~/Desktop/Trichoglossus_moluccanus_with_open_wings\,_Brisbane-CMYK.tif 
3.1.0
<type 'tuple'>
```

Test image was converted to CMYK with GIMP as outlined in this [ask ubuntu question](https://askubuntu.com/questions/114858/how-to-convert-image-to-cmyk-in-gimp). The Separate+ plugin is in `gimp-plugin-registry` package on debian/ubuntu. Make sure that the color profile gets actually embedded when exporting the image.

My test image is from [wikipedia](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Trichoglossus_moluccanus_with_open_wings,_Brisbane.jpg), I've attached the CMYK version for your convenience.

[icc profile test images.zip](https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/files/170374/icc.profile.test.images.zip)
Oh, this is also reproducible using [Tests/images/hopper.iccprofile.tif](../blob/master/Tests/images/hopper.iccprofile.tif)

This is still reproducible in master using [this TIFF file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B0PanjXpbSyHS1l1OU5iRUtYZDQ/view?usp=sharing)

```
image = Image.open(image_file)
image.save('test.png')
```

results in

```
builtins.TypeError
TypeError: a bytes-like object is required, not 'tuple'
```

issue.title: icc_profile

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Any unexpected behavior, until confirmed feature.

issue.body:
```
from PIL import Image
Image.open('Pillow/Tests/images/hopper.iccprofile.tif').save('test.png')
```

In Python 3.5, this results in

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  Line 2, in <module>
    Image.open('Pillow/Tests/images/hopper.iccprofile.tif').save('test.png')
  File "PIL/Image.py", line 1675, in save
    save_handler(self, fp, filename)
  File "PIL/PngImagePlugin.py", line 757, in _save
    data = name + b"\0\0" + zlib.compress(im.info["icc_profile"])
TypeError: a bytes-like object is required, not 'tuple'
```

In Python 3.3 and 3.4, it's `TypeError: 'tuple' does not support the buffer interface`. In Python 2.7, it's `TypeError: must be string or read-only buffer, not tuple`

`im.info["icc_profile"]` is a tuple of length 1, where the first argument is a bytes-like object.

body:
Reproducible with latest Pillow 3.2.0 (Python 2.7 / OS X):

``` python
>>> from PIL import Image
>>> image_file = "LI_MAG_P_20110810_017.tif"
>>> image = Image.open(image_file)
>>> image.save('test.png')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/Image.py", line 1687, in save
    save_handler(self, fp, filename)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/PngImagePlugin.py", line 757, in _save
    data = name + b"\0\0" + zlib.compress(im.info["icc_profile"])
TypeError: must be string or read-only buffer, not tuple
```

Pillow 2.9.0 passes, Pillow 3.0.0 errors.

I think the problem is setting again the ICCPROFILE length to 0 (this makes the im.info['icc_profile'] to be a tuple), this was in the commit a14467f10bfc269511f4bffcf6b64fbab94ac959 of @wiredfool. The icc_profile haven't a fixed length in the number of bytes, but have a fixed length in the number of values (I'm not sure, but i think so).

Anyway the unique usage of the length in the TiffImagePlugin.py file is for define where to return a value or a tuple. To be compatible with PNG this must be a bytes and not a tuple.

I going to make a small PR with this change to discuss there.

issue.title: Fix the problem with icc_profile on tiff to png conversion
issue.body: Taking care of special cases for icc_profile information to always return a bytes variable.

body:
Length 0 means that it's of indeterminate length. 

Is there a test that can be done with the test files that we have that can demonstrate this? Or do we need to add an image for a useful test case?
This is also reproducible using the following file which is already included [Tests/images/hopper.iccprofile.tif](../blob/master/Tests/images/hopper.iccprofile.tif)
